result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Lavell Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$11,474.34 payable to Wells Fargo Bank.  To be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

*Provide DNA sample, surcharge waived due to large amount of restitution ordered.
All  remaining surcharges, fees, assessments and costs waived due to large amount of restitution ordered by the Court.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment. Particpate in vocatinal training/job skills program if available.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Wells Fargo Bank.

Participate in cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statues section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

Original Transcript (44 pages) commencing on 08-12-2014 SENTENCING received and filed.

Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court, defendant Corey Lavell Anderson not in court, in custody(Milwaukee Secure Detention Center).  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Houghton appears as successor counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Defendant Corey Lavell Anderson in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Corey Lavell Anderson in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Defense motion to withdraw due to conflict heard and granted by the Court.  Defense to notify the public defender's office of the need for new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Intern Gabriela Leija under the supervision of Attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Corey Lavell Anderson not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Motion to withdraw filed by defense.  Court unable to hear the motion on today as the defendant was not produced from the Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Withdraw as Attorney, received and filed.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Corey Lavell Anderson not in court, in custody (msdf).  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for plea and sentencing.  Branch 21 and ADA Ballenger in jury trial on an unrelated matter.  Defense advised that the court is unable to hear this matter on today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Corey Lavell Anderson not in court, in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M. Jaspers in court, defendant Corey Lavell Anderson not in court, in custody (MSDF).  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Wells Fargo Bank

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.

Defendant Corey Lavell Anderson in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Corey Lavell Anderson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
